Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; cream slip; exterior reserved streaky brown bands at bottom and top of sherd; inscription cut facing out on upper wall; interior: between bands with superimposed traces of added colour, animal frieze to left, deer and lion with paw raised behind; incised rosette fill and red details; slight remains of friezes above and below.
Curator's comments: 1888,0601.557c joins on the left and1965,0930.711 on the left. From the same bowl as 1924,1201.992, 993 and 994 and probably from same bowl as 1888,0601.557 a. Hutton, Classical Review 1893, 83 desribes a plate with a similar inscription as a dedication by a Rhodian; the description seems to be of a different object, now seemingly lost. Hutton's interpretation of the letter as a rho, and therefore the beginning of the ethnic Rodios, must be doubted; we would expect the definite article, and ο Χιος or ο Τηιος would fit well.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 65, no. 776, pl. XXI, no. 776)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 684, no. 427)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.210)
